7.verification_summary: For a Bernoulli estimate with n trials, the standard error of p hat is sqrt(p(1-p)/n) so absolute error shrinks with p and n, while relative error scales as sqrt((1-p)/(n p)), which grows as p decreases; hence rare events have smaller absolute error but larger relative uncertainty, making the claim plausible under finite sample binomial estimation.
